title: Remove Compiler ivars
body:
Remove all instance variables from the Compiler base class.

- Make Compiler inherit from Obj instead of Query.
- Use per-subclass ivar for boost if needed.
- Copy some relevant ivars from the respective Query.
- Fetch Similarity from DataReader's schema.

title: Improve locking code (v2)
body:
[Diff to previous pull request](https://gist.github.com/nwellnhof/f262bcd53c3d69281748571410a0bdbd).

Fixes [LUCY-323](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCY-323).

- Major rewrite of FilePurger, making it do less work.
- Eliminate global deletion lock, making PolyReader and FilePurger never wait for a lock.
- Redesign Lock API in preparation for native locks.
- Remove LockFactory.
- Fix locking bug with non-default merge lock timeout.
- Fix locking bug with concurrent BackgroundMergers.
- Port some tests to C.

title: Improve locking code
body:
Fixes [LUCY-323](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCY-323).

- Major rewrite of FilePurger, making it do less work.
- Eliminate global deletion lock, making PolyReader and FilePurger never wait for a lock.
- Redesign Lock API in preparation for native locks.
- Remove LockFactory.
- Fix locking bug with non-default merge lock timeout.
- Fix locking bug with concurrent BackgroundMergers.
- Port some tests to C.

title: Stop using strerror
body:
Especially with non-English locales, 'strerror' can return strings in
arbitrary encodings. Now that CB_VCatF has more thorough UTF-8 checks,
this can result in unwanted exceptions.

'strerror' also isn't thread-safe.

Add some utility functions to set the global error object, optionally
followed by a textual representation of the error in 'errno' or
returned by 'GetLastError' on Windows. Convert 'errno' values using
custom messages for all 'errno' macros from current Linux and Darwin
kernels.

Also make some error messages more informative by adding the reason
for the error, e.g. in FSDH_do_open which may fail when opening an
index.

Fixes LUCY-311.

title: Move some string helpers back to Lucy
LUCY-295 Misc int type fixes, part 2
body:
Misc int type fixes for -Wconversion, part 2.
-   frequencies (term freq, doc freq)
-   doc counts
-   pointer math results
-   change return type of Sim_Encode_Norm to uint8_t
-   grab bag of other fixes

The only remaining -Wconversion warnings from core/ after this branch gets
merged are in BitVec_Next_Hit, which is arguably buggy.

title: LUCY-295 Misc -Wconversion, part 1
body:
Attend to miscellaneous integer conversion warnings.
- Doc IDs.
- Timeouts.
- Sort ordinals.
- "Tick" array indexes.

title: LUCY-295 Int widths for text/byte sizes
body:
Address -Wconversion warnings relating to string lengths, code point counts, and binary data lengths.

In addition, minor refactoring of Inversion.

title: LUCY-295 Adapt file position code for -Wconversion
body: Perform casts or variable type conversions in code manipulating file positions in order to adapt for -Wconversion.

title: LUCY-295 Fix int types in unit tests
body: Fix -Wconversion warnings in the Lucy unit tests.

title: LUCY-295 More Clownfish size_t adaptations
body: Adapt Lucy code for better conformance with Clownfish APIs -- in particular, those that have changed to use size_t for element counts.

title: LUCY-302 NumUtils warnings
body:
In NumberUtils.cfh:
- Widen the array index type for addressing 1-bit, 2-bit, and 4-bit arrays.
- Address a few (false positive) compiler warnings from `-Wconversion`.

title: LUCY-301 C32/C64 transition
body:
At present, InStream, OutStream, and NumberUtils provide an unsigned compressed format called C32/C64 -- and when we need signed representations, we just cast.

To get rid of all these casts (and fix some sites missing casts), support signed and unsigned variants.

title: LUCY-300 Forbid fields above 2 GB.
body:
Check for fields above 2 GB before the document enters the any writer
subcomponents below SegWriter.

title: LUCY-295 BitVector size_t ticks
body: Change BitVector to use `size_t` instead of `uint32_t` to address bits in the array.

title: LUCY-295 Change I32Array to use size_t (v2)
body:
Change I32Array so that it uses a size_t to index into its array of 32-bit integers. This entails both changes to the class internals and to the internal API. (I32Array is not a public API.)

This pull requests adds one commit to fix the Go bindings compared to v1.

title: LUCY-295 Change I32Array to use size_t
body: Change I32Array so that it uses a size_t to index into its array of 32-bit integers. This entails both changes to the class internals and to the internal API. (I32Array is not a public API.)

title: Dereference token_re on older Perls
body:
Might fix the following CPAN Testers failure:

http://www.cpantesters.org/cpan/report/8c9a1bc2-fa55-11e5-b227-b497ee9ed8df

I'm really puzzled why the old and the new code seem to work on most
setups.

Hopefully fixes LUCY-297.

title: LUCY-295 Adapt for changed return type of Vec_Get_Size
body:
The Clownfish API `Vec_Get_Size` has changed from returning `uint32_t` to returning `size_t`.  Adapt Lucy for the effect of this change.

This branch is broken up into commits according to the kind of remedy that was applied at each site, and the associated difficulty of proofing the change.

title: LUCY-294 Ensure nul-terminated C strings in test code.
body:
Use `Str_To_Utf8` which is guaranteed to return a nul-terminated C
string instead of `Str_To_Ptr8`.

title: LUCY-292 Fix refcount order when overwriting.
body:
When there's a possibility that a recounted value is overwriting itself,
delay the decref until after any incref so that there is no way the
refcount can fall to 0 prior to the incref.

title: Document all public constructors and initializers
body:
Documentation diff: https://github.com/nwellnhof/lucy/commit/1c73d7b0b6ff8c65ce56300aa90cd2e8fe34f974

Documentation diff for additional commits: https://github.com/nwellnhof/lucy/commit/b305b1423dd737075573ebebc90748675e18285a

title: LUCY-282 Go bindings for QueryParser
body: Tune and test the Go bindings for QueryParser.

title: LUCY-282 Go index part 2
body:
Continue with tuning and testing the Go bindings for Lucy's indexing components.
- IndexReader
- Lexicon
- PostingList, Posting
- Various DataReaders and DataWriters

title: LUCY-282 Go Highlight
body: Tune and test custom bindings for Highlighter and HeatMap.

title: LUCY-282 Misc Go part 1
body: Tune and test Go bindings for a variety of classes and methods.  Some were overlooked during the first pass through the codebase creating custom Go bindings.

title: Adjust for changes to ByteBuf and CharBuf API
Improve SortExternal
body: My main motivation was to switch to a custom implementation of Clownfish's `Sort_merge`. I added some improvements to `S_absorb_slices` along the way.

title: LUCY-282 Test Go bindings for Index compoments pt1
body:
Tune and and test the Go bindings for various "Index" components.

The autogenerated Go bindings suffice for some of these classes, but many others require tweaking. The most common customizations relate to providing idiomatic error handling and subtyping slices.

title: LUCY-282 Refine Go bindings for Store (IO) classes
body:
Tune and test Go bindings for Store classes.

The Store (IO) classes for Lucy require a disproportionate number of hand-coded method bindings because Clownfish yet doesn't have a way of autogenerating idiomatic Go error handling, where non-fatal errors are returned as part of a tuple return value instead of triggering exceptions.

title: LUCY-282 Test Go bindings for Analysis classes
body: Refine and test the Go bindings for Token, Inversion and various Analyzers.

title: LUCY-282 Test Go bindings for Plan classes
body: Refine and test the Go bindings for Schema, various FieldTypes, and Architecture.

title: LUCY-285 Run core tests under Go
body:
Run the core tests under the Go bindings, just as we do under other host bindings.

Skip Analysis tests when the test data can't be found.

title: LUCY-284 Support Go host types as doc
body:
Support the following types as documents in Go bindings:
-   Doc objects wrapped in Go bindings
-   `map[string]interface{}`
-   Go structs (field names matched case-insensitively)

title: LUCY-282 Refine Go part 2
body: Continuing on with testing and customizing the Go bindings for Search classes.

title: LUCY-282 Refine Go bindings pt1
body:
Refine Go bindings and add tests for many search classes, especially the Query classes.

Also fix argument handling for OpenIndexer and OpenIndexSearcher.

title: Generate Perl POD from public methods
body:
The Clownfish branch `perl_pod` adds POD for public novel methods by default, making it possible to remove the POD "whitelists".

This branch also adds Perl documentation for Analyzer, Inversion, and Token, which is needed to write custom analyzers. It also removes documentation for some methods taking private classes as parameters.

title: LUCY-281 Go/CGO port
body:
Port host-specific implementation code to Go/CGO instead of wrapping the C bindings.

RegexTokenizer now uses the Go `regexp` package instead of requiring pcre.  It references `regexp` objects from C using a variant on the Nick Wellnhofer's object registry code.

title: Remove now-redundant Go ctor bindings.
body:
Now that Clownfish autogenerates constructor bindings, these are not needed.

This "v2" pull request removes an additional obsolete hand-coded binding.

title: Go constructor autogen
body:
Adapt for recent changes to Clownfish in apache/lucy-clownfish#26.

A couple constructor bindings which were hand-coded can now be autogenerated.

title: LUCY-279 Obj method removal
body: This pull request contains some more or less unrelated changes to the way number fields are handled. It turned out that the Perl bindings didn't support storing Num objects in number fields from C space. The behavior of number fields in the C bindings has changed, too. Automatic conversion from Strings to Nums isn't supported anymore. There are different ways to reenable this feature, although I don't think it's important.

title: LUCY-277 Adapt for autogenerated Go bindings
body: Replace some hand-coded proof-of-concept Go bindings with autogenerated Go glue.

title: LUCY-275 Adapt Lucy for v4 of Go proof-of-concept bindings.
CLOWNFISH-39 Public Vector API
body: Please review the changes to IxManager_Recycle.

title: LUCY-275 Go proof-of-concept take 2
body:
This updates Lucy's hand-coded proof-of-concept Go bindings to sync with additional changes to Clownfish.

See LUCY-275.

title: LUCY-275 proof-of-concept Go bindings
body: This is the material from the go_bindings_1 branch updated and rebased on top of the current master.

title: LUCY-274 Adapt to Clownfish refcounting API changes
body: This fixes LUCY-274.

title: Inline code from `Json_spew_json`.
body:
Change logic to attempt deletion of the PID lockfile regardless of the outcome of writing to the lockfile.

This fixes LUCY-265.

title: Remove clownfish
body:
Remove Clownfish from the Lucy repository. This branch eliminates the Perl bindings' dependency on the bundled Clownfish directory.

After applying this patch sequence both the Perl bindings and the C bindings build without error.

Marvin Humphrey and I collaborated on this patch sequence.

title: Dummy commit.
body: This is a test pull request.  We are about to create a pull request deleting all of Clownfish from the lucy.git repository.  Infra has recently updated the Apache Github integration, and I want to confirm that pull request emails still do not include diffs -- because we don't want to send a 65,000 line diff to the Lucy dev list.

title: Add specified blib directory to lucy_indexer subprocesses
Remove casting-away-const-ness
body:
Now that we've migrated from `const CharBuf*` through `const String*` to
simply `String*`, this long-awaited change can be made.

title: Separate Clownfish and CFC
body:
-   `Clownfish::CFC` is a compiler written in C.  It has no prerequisites
  aside from the host language.
-   `Clownfish` is the Clownfish core (Hash, CharBuf, VTable, Method, etc.).
  It depends on `Clownfish::CFC`.

The plan here is to copy the Clownfish core, work on it until it builds on its
own, then integrate it into the Lucy core and once that's complete, delete the
originals from the Lucy core.
